page.title: 16SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY
page.content: {SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY } The{Pershore Horticultural College}has a reputation for experimentation in the growth and development of fruit and vegetables. {Hydroponics,}the growing of plants in water with nutrients added, has been pioneered at the College and many countries of the World have been interested in the advances made in this field. Experimentation in hybrid plant production, virus elimination and tissue culture are pursued at the College. Many firms are introducing the new {computer technology}to help with their records and accounting and the farmers of the area are among the most technologically advanced in Europe using computer data to run their farms.
